column9: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana includes existing National Agriculture Insurance Scheme (NAIS), Weather-based crop insurance scheme, Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (MNAIS) being implemented through Agriculture Insurance Corporation and Coconut Palm Insurance Scheme
column10: The Prime Minister Fasal Bima Yojana has been coined by combining earlier insurance schemes for farmers.  An allocation to the tune of Rs. 5,500 crore proposed in the Budget 2016-17, which shows an upward revision of the allocation from Rs, 2955 crore in 2016-17 RE.

The allocation for RKVY got slight increase in the current budget, which is far from satisfactory, however, due to change is fund sharing pattern, it is expected that the states’ would put relevant share (40 %) towards the programme.

The declined allocation for NFSM in 2016-17 BE compared to 2014-15 (although the repriorisation in favour of Pulses Mission, with an additional allocation of Rs. 500 core, incentivizing farmers for pulse cultivation) seems the thrust of meeting the demand-supply mis-match of pulses in the country.

The allocation for PMKSY (within MoA) has been increased from Rs. 1800 crore to Rs. 2340 core seems quite inadequate if one looks at the percentage of cultivable area under irrigation (46 %) in the country.
